body:
Hi. For context, I’m Camille’s narrative writer. I’m responsible for Camille’s VO and I also wrote “The Weakest Heart”, “Tea with the Gray Lady”, and her bio.

I don’t usually post on the boards (we writers tend to be a little shy), but I do read. As the author of the above stories, I want to ease the fears of Viktor fans where I can. I understand it feels crappy to wait in the dark and wonder. My intention in “The Weakest Heart” was never to strip Viktor of his background. Two of Viktor’s core narrative pillars for me are that he is a fervent believer in his cause and that he is a man of science. 

On a recent devblog Ant in Oz mentioned the idea of a story hook. I thought ‘evolving’ the Glorious Evolution could be a good hook to dig into with Viktor and challenge him as a character. (Part of building story hooks is also to make hooks we, as the writers who might be using them in the future, want to tell.) 

Viktor wants to bring people to his cause. He wants those people who join him to understand his cause as he does. As some have speculated here, what if some of those people see more of the miracle and less of the science? What would a man of science do with that? For me as a writer, that’s a juicy character question to build a story around. (Which is why I didn’t give Camille an aside on Viktor in "The Weakest Heart". I thought it would be a bit cheap to answer it that way versus a story that centered on Viktor as the protagonist.)

I hope this clarifies things a bit and helps Viktor fans sleep better tonight.

replies.body:
Oh thank Nagakabouros you came in here ThermalKitten. Hopefully this helps ease some people's concerns.

Also, brilliant work on Camille as a whole. You've written her as well, if not even better than you wrote Taliyah. My hat's off to you!

It is late, or early (2:00 AM to be precise) so forgive me if I am incoherent.

I, and others, appreciate that you have taken the time to address the concerns some players had regarding the most recent lore developments and their connection to Viktor. I would wager your hook was successful in that when the Glorious Evolved were revealed many, for better or worse, immediately turned to scrutinizing Viktor's possible connection and what it might imply. I think it has been made quite apparent that fans of Viktor are quite defensive of his character as remembered from the early days of League, a sensitivity that is not unfounded considering the uproar that occurred when Jayce's initial lore was introduced. We mean no disrespect, and I hope those who have something to say are more inclined towards critique rather than criticism.

That said, I would like to thank you for Weakest Heart; it is thus far my favorite piece written for League. The story is clear, delivers a plot that is wrapped up by the end while providing a wealth of detail and history that gives it greater depth. I have sympathy for Camille whereas before I doubted it would be possible with how callous her voice lines were. Well done, and best of luck.

However, this is about already established characters that already have an identity. People who love viktor, diana, leona, etc love the CHARACTER not the name. Just because she still has the name "leona" means nothing. In fact if they changed her name alone it wouldn't matter as long as she was still "herself". Hello Thermal Kitten, thank you so much for replying! This means a lot, really.

I'm the person who created the first concern thread; a preemptive plea is better than a late one, and I guess we succeeded in getting a response.

I'm sorry if the titles of the threads sounded scary, that's because we ourselves were scared and were trying to get the attention of people infinitely more powerful than us. I saw the hook, I noticed how Viktor's name wasn't mentioned in the Weakest Heart.

We just couldn't have been sure if he indeed wasn't leading these cults, or if it was the case of a preparation for the change of his original lore.

The possible version where he actually disapproves of these cults or even actively tries to disassemble them is very interesting. This builds on top of the established character who is rather reclusive by evolving the ways the world around him reacts to his inventions. These would be in a way consequences of his work which he didn't predict, and with which he has to deal now. This challenges him because in a sense, he's creating obstacles for himself. I very much like the way you created an introduction for a story element, the hook is good! Revealing everything in the same moment would have overwhelmed a story. The way you write** is** awesome.

I would only add this: the third important thing about his character is that he was extremely naive up until recently. And he possibly still is. "The scary Machine Herald is actually naive". I haven't seen this possibility in any other League character, and I believe it does wonders for him. He got his inventions and blueprints stolen from him not once, but twice. He was thinking there would be justice in Zaun (arguably one of the most immoral places on the planet), and he believed Jayce would work with him, even after he became the Machine Herald.
